title: Email: Force plain text and word wrap at 72, does not work
content:
I have the same issue as this year-old, unanswered thread: [wrap sent message view?]

What I want: I want all my sent e-mail messaged to by default be written and formatted as:

  • Plain text
  • Fixed width
  • Automatically line break/word wrap (unsure of the correct eng. term), at 72 characters
  • I also want to SEE the 72-character line break/inline WHILE I COMPOSE the message, no matter the size of my e-mail composing window (I have a large monitor)

What I have done:

  • Found the mailnews.wraplength setting in config editor, and set it to 72 (it was already on 72)
  • Set Composition to: Font: Fixed width, Sending format: Only Plain Text

The issue:

  • When creating a new email, the "font" setting i Fixed width
  • When pasting/replying to that same e-mail, everything goes to variable width, calibri, other formatting
  • In any case, the TEXT DOES NOT WORD WRAP/LINE BREAK AT 72 CHARACTERS

I have also tried troubleshooting mode.

PLEASE help.
creator: PPAbrigo

title: Sending of the message failed. An error occurred while sending mail: Outgoing server (SMTP) error. The server responded:  smtp687.syd.oss-core.net Off-net-IP Detected.
content:
I can't send out any emails. I get this message, and I'm not a computer whiz. "Sending of the message failed. An error occurred while sending mail: Outgoing server (SMTP) error. The server responded: smtp687.syd.oss-core.net Off-net-IP Detected." I tether my mobile phone to my internet to send emails. My phone doesn't receive emails at all as it's not set up to receive emails.

Many thanks for this old girl!!

title: An apology
content: I must apologize for repeated messages but I got no responses until I checked spam this evening. Somehow the one message went to an email account that does not exist. I went 12 days unable to send mail and somehow tonight it was fixed. I have to think there was a patch made that solved the problem. But yes, I did repeated messaged hoping for an answer. I am sorry someone was offended but I was desperate and got NO answers to my email address. As a Mozilla/thunderbird supporter I am disappointed.
creator: lorilohman
